answers.answer: Hi!Commonest cause of a sensation of urination is UTI, both due to a STD and non STD infection. It is also seen in diabetis mellitus and diabetes insipidus. Small for size bladder is another cause and so also neurogenic bladder. Another possibility is a polyp or a growth inside the urethra. At times a hair too grows inwards and keeps tickling the urethra causing a need to urinate. A frenulum tag too can cause this type of sensation.You must talk to your physician regarding all these possibilities. You would need some more tests beside urine analysis to reach a confirmed diagnosis. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: im a male 19 years old, i always have the feeling to urinate problem i feel uncomfortable if i never go but i have no pain or burn in that case.and its always in my mind and i cant stop thinking about it. i went to the doctor ytd and have a urinate test came out everything was fine and he said is because im anxiety and stress. anybody can help me to stop the feeling to urinate?
title: urinate problem
